From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: förmår

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin formāre.

Verb

[edit]

formar (first-person singular indicative present formo, past participle formáu)

  1. to form (to give shape)
  2. to form, make up
  3. to make, form
  4. to bring up, raise

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of formar
infinitive formar
gerund formando
past participle m formáu, f formada, n formao, m pl formaos, f pl formaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present formo formes forma formamos formáis formen
imperfect formaba formabes formaba formábemos, formábamos formabeis, formabais formaben
preterite formé formasti, formesti formó formemos formastis, formestis formaron
pluperfect formare, formara formares, formaras formare, formara formáremos, formáramos formareis, formarais formaren, formaran
future formaré formarás formará formaremos formaréis formarán
conditional formaría formaríes formaría formaríemos, formaríamos formaríeis, formaríais formaríen
subjunctive present forme formes, formas forme formemos forméis formen, forman
imperfect formare, formara formares, formaras formare, formara formáremos, formáramos formareis, formarais formaren, formaran
imperative — forma — — formái —

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin fōrmāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [furˈma]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [forˈma]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [foɾˈmaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

formar (first-person singular present formo, first-person singular preterite formí, past participle format); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /o/

  1. to shape
  2. to teach, instruct, show
  3. to form

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of formar (first conjugation)
infinitive formar
gerund formant
past participle masculine feminine
singular format formada
plural formats formades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès

imperfect formava formaves formava formàvem formàveu formaven
future formaré formaràs formarà formarem formareu formaran
preterite formí formares formà formàrem formàreu formaren
conditional formaria formaries formaria formaríem formaríeu formarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès

imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — forma formi formem formeu formin
negative (no) — no formis no formi no formem no formeu no formin

Related terms

[edit]
  • forma
  • formació
  • formatiu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “formar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “formar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “formar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “formar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Occitan [Term?], from Latin formāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

formar

  1. (transitive) to form

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb needs an inflection-table template.

Related terms

[edit]
  • forma

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Galician-Portuguese formar, from Latin fōrmāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /foʁˈma(ʁ)/ [foɦˈma(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /foʁˈma(ʁ)/ [foɦˈma(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /foɾˈma(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /foʁˈma(ʁ)/ [foʁˈma(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /foɻˈma(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /fuɾˈmaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /fuɾˈmaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /fuɾˈma.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: for‧mar

Verb

[edit]

formar (first-person singular present formo, first-person singular preterite formei, past participle formado)

  1. to form
  2. (pronominal) to graduate, to receive a degree

Conjugation

[edit]

Negative (não) não formes não forme não formemos não formeis não formem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Quotations

[edit]

For quotations using this term, see Citations:formar.

Romanian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From formă +‎ -ar.

Noun

[edit]

formar m (plural formari)

  1. moulder

Declension

[edit]
singular plural
indefinite definite indefinite definite
nominative-accusative formar formarul formari formarii
genitive-dative formar formarului formari formarilor
vocative formarule formarilor

Romansch

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • furmar (Rumantsch Grischun, Sutsilvan, Surmiran)
  • furmer (Puter)
  • fuormar (Vallader)

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin formāre.

Verb

[edit]

formar

  1. (Sursilvan) to shape, form

Related terms

[edit]
  • fuorma

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin formāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /foɾˈmaɾ/ [foɾˈmaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: for‧mar

Verb

[edit]

formar (first-person singular present formo, first-person singular preterite formé, past participle formado)

  1. (transitive) to form, to create
  2. (transitive) to train, to educate
  3. (transitive) to make up, to constitute
  4. (intransitive) to line up (to get in a line)

Conjugation

[edit]

Swedish

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

formar

  1. indefinite plural of form

Verb

[edit]

formar

  1. present indicative of forma
